abstracts.cdata!:
The project provided satisfactory
            results for Vietnam. A substantial debt reduction was
            effected and debt obligations were regularized, favoring a
            sustainable balance of payments and state budget. However,
            secondary market prices have fallen, reflecting both the
            external environment due to the Asian financial crisis, and
            perceived weakened prospects for Vietnam. The key lessons
            learned show that the immediate objective of reducing
            external obligations was achieved in an overall strategy on
            external debt management. The grant from the Debt Reduction
            Facility provided legal and financial assistance for
            mastering the intricacies of international finances and debt
            restructuring activities, allowing a smooth implementation
            of the project. The effective cooperation and coordination
            between the Government and the Bank, gave way to successful
            preparation, appraisal, and implementation of the project.
            Nevertheless, experience suggests that a successful debt
            rescheduling can only be achieved within the context of a
            viable structural reform program. Further external debt
            strategies are required, namely, the negotiation of the debt
            rescheduling package with the Russian Federation, and the
            coordination of an external debt management for sustainable
            creditworthiness, servicing external obligations.
